name: Brunei Darussalam
description: Brunei Darussalam, often simply called Brunei, is a small, oil-rich nation located on the north coast of Borneo. It’s characterized by a unique blend of Malay, indigenous, and British influences, resulting in a rich cultural heritage. The country is renowned for its commitment to preserving its natural environment, particularly its rainforests and extensive mangrove areas.  Brunei’s economy is heavily reliant on oil and gas, but tourism is increasingly important, driven by its natural beauty and cultural attractions.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Malay is the official language of Brunei. English is also widely spoken and used in government and business.
quickFacts.detail: The language reflects a blend of Malay, Indonesian, and local dialects.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Brunei has a relatively small population, primarily Malay.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is very high due to the country's limited land area.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Bandar Seri Begawan is the capital and largest city of Brunei.
quickFacts.detail: It’s a planned city known for its unique architecture and royal palace.

quickFacts.label: GDP per capita
quickFacts.description: Brunei boasts one of the highest GDP per capita in Southeast Asia.
quickFacts.detail: This is largely due to its oil and gas reserves.

quickFacts.label: Religion
quickFacts.description: Islam is the state religion of Brunei.
quickFacts.detail: The Sultan of Brunei is also the head of state and the spiritual leader.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Brunei is a relatively small country.
quickFacts.detail: It’s the second smallest country in Southeast Asia.

climateData.title: Tropical Rainforest Climate
climateData.description: Brunei experiences a tropical rainforest climate, characterized by consistently high temperatures and humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is abundant, with distinct wet and dry seasons.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season (November - March)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings heavy rainfall, high humidity, and frequent thunderstorms. Rivers swell, and some areas become flooded.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season (April - October)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season offers pleasant temperatures and lower humidity. Rainfall is significantly reduced, and the sun shines brightly.

naturalWonders.name: Temburong Rainforest Reserve
naturalWonders.description: The Temburong Rainforest Reserve is a vast expanse of pristine rainforest, home to a remarkable diversity of flora and fauna. It’s a crucial area for biodiversity conservation and offers incredible opportunities for ecotourism.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This reserve is particularly known for its unique plant species, including the Temburong fig tree, and its rich birdlife.  It’s a vital corridor connecting different parts of the country’s rainforests.

naturalWonders.name: Jerantut Mangrove Forest
naturalWonders.description: The Jerantut Mangrove Forest is a stunning coastal ecosystem, characterized by dense mangrove forests and mudflats. It’s a vital habitat for numerous bird species and marine life.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The mangroves play a crucial role in protecting the coastline from erosion and providing a nursery ground for fish and other marine organisms.  It’s a significant area for carbon sequestration.

ecosystemData.title: Brunei’s Rainforest Ecosystem
ecosystemData.overview: Brunei’s rainforests are a globally significant biodiversity hotspot, representing a substantial portion of Borneo’s remaining primary rainforest. They are characterized by high rainfall, dense vegetation, and a remarkable array of plant and animal species.

biodiversityCategories.name: Birds
biodiversityCategories.description: Brunei is a birdwatcher’s paradise, boasting a diverse range of avian species, including hornbills, raptors, and migratory birds.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mammals
biodiversityCategories.description: Brunei’s rainforests are home to a variety of mammals, including proboscis monkeys, clouded leopards, and various deer species.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Brunei
activities.description: Brunei offers a range of outdoor activities, catering to various levels of experience and fitness.  The country’s natural beauty provides a stunning backdrop for adventure and exploration.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Brunei’s rainforests and hills on foot.

activities.name: Temburong Rainforest Trek
activities.description: A challenging trek through the Temburong Rainforest, offering stunning views and wildlife encounters.
activities.requirements: Hiking boots, insect repellent, water bottle

activities.name: Jerantut Mangrove Trail
activities.description: A leisurely walk through the Jerantut Mangrove Forest, offering a chance to observe wildlife and learn about the ecosystem.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the Brunei River and coastal waters with a variety of water sports.

activities.name: River Cruise
activities.description: Relaxing cruise along the Brunei River, offering views of the capital and surrounding areas.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore the mangrove forests and coastal areas by kayak.

clothing.yearRound: Modest clothing is recommended when visiting religious sites

equipment.basic: Sunscreen, insect repellent, water bottle, flashlight
